004package kut;
005
006import java.util.Random;
007import java.util.Locale;
008import java.text.DecimalFormat;
009import java.text.DecimalFormatSymbols;
010
011/** Mathematical functions */
012public class Mth {
013  Mth () {};
014
015  static final Random random = new Random();
016
017  /**
018   * Returns a String from a double.
019   * @param n A number
020   * @return A Stringg.
021   */
022  public static String dtos (double n) {
023    String r = dtos(n, 9);
024    while (r.endsWith("0")) r = r.substring(0, r.length() - 1);
025    if (r.endsWith(".")) r = r.substring(0, r.length() - 1);
026    return r;
027  }
028
029  /**
030   * Returns a String type "nnnn.nnn"
031   * @param n A number
032   * @param dec Number of decimal positions between 0 and 9 (both inclusive).<p>
033   *            'dec' is adjusted to that limits.
034   * @return String type "nnnn.nnn".
035   */
036  public static String dtos (double n, int dec) {
037    if (dec < 0) dec = 0;
038    else if (dec > 9) dec = 9;
039    return Str.fmt("%." + String.valueOf(dec) + "f", n).replace(",", ".");
040  }
041
042  /**
043   * Returns "true" if n1 &lt; n2 + gap and n1 > n2 - gap<p>
044   * 'gap' is forzed to a value between '0.0000000001' and '1' (both inclusive).
045   * @param n1 Number.
046   * @param n2 Number.
047   * @param gap Gap.
048   * @return Result.
049   */
050  public static boolean eq (double n1, double n2, double gap) {
051    gap = gap > 1 ? 1 : gap < 0.0000000001 ? 0.0000000001 : gap;
052    return n1 < n2 + gap && n1 > n2 - gap;
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * Equals to 'eq(n1, n2, 0.0000000001)'
057   * @param n1 Number.
058   * @param n2 Number.
059   * @return Result.
060   */
061  public static boolean eq (double n1, double n2) {
062    return eq(n1, n2, 0.0000000001);
063  }
064
065  /**
066   * Returns the double value of 'n' or 'Opt.none()' if 'n' is not a number.
067   * @param n String in english format.
068   * @return Double value of 'n'.
069   */
070  public static Opt<Double> fromEn (String n) {
071    return stod(n.replace(",", ""));
072  }
073
074  /**
075   * Returns the double value of 'n' or 'Opt.none()' if 'n' is not a number.
076   * @param n String in ISO format.
077   * @return Double value of 'n'.
078   */
079  public static Opt<Double> fromIso (String n) {
080    return stod(n.replace(".", "").replace(",", "."));
081  }
082
083  /**
084   * Returns 'true' if 's' is not empty and only contains digits.
085   * @param s String to test.
086   * @return Result of test.
087   */
088  public static boolean isDigits (String s) {
089    int sz = s.length();
090    if (sz == 0) return false;
091    int i = 0;
092    for (;;) {
093      char ch = s.charAt(i++);
094      if (ch < '0' || ch > '9') return false;
095      if (i >= sz) return true;
096    }
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Returns a String from a long.
101   * @param n A number
102   * @return A Stringg.
103   */
104  public static String itos (long n) {
105    return String.valueOf(n);
106  }
107
108  /**
109   * Returns a random number between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive).
110   * @return Random number between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (exclusive).
111   */
112  public static double rnd () {
113    return random.nextDouble();
114  }
115
116  /**
117   * Returns a random number between 0 (inclusive) and 'bound' (exclusive).
118   * @param bound Limit for generator (must be positive)
119   * @return Random number between 0 (inclusive) and 'bound' (exclusive).
120   */
121  public static int rndi (int bound) {
122    return random.nextInt(bound);
123  }
124
125  /**
126   * Returns 'n' rounded with 'dec' decimals.
127   * @param n Number to round.
128   * @param dec Decimal positions. Forzed from '0' to '9', both inclusive.
129   * @return 'n' rounded.
130   */
131  public static double round (double n, int dec) {
132    switch (dec) {
133      case 0: return Math.round(n);
134      case 1: return Math.round(n * 10.0) / 10.0;
135      case 2: return Math.round(n * 100.0) / 100.0;
136      case 3: return Math.round(n * 1000.0) / 1000.0;
137      case 4: return Math.round(n * 10000.0) / 10000.0;
138      case 5: return Math.round(n * 100000.0) / 100000.0;
139      case 6: return Math.round(n * 1000000.0) / 1000000.0;
140      case 7: return Math.round(n * 10000000.0) / 10000000.0;
141      case 8: return Math.round(n * 100000000.0) / 100000000.0;
142      case 9: return Math.round(n * 1000000000.0) / 1000000000.0;
143      default: if (dec < 0) return Math.round(n);
144               else return Math.round(n * 1000000000.0) / 1000000000.0;
145    }
146  }
147
148  /**
149   * Returns the integer value of 'n' or 'Opt.none()' if 'n' is not a number.
150   * @param n String.
151   * @return Integer value of 'n'.
152   */
153  public static Opt<Integer> stoi (String n) {
154    try {
155      return Opt.some(Integer.valueOf(n));
156    } catch (Exception e) {
157      return Opt.none();
158    }
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Returns the long value of 'n' or 'Opt.none()' if 'n' is not a number.
163   * @param n String.
164   * @return Long value of 'n'.
165   */
166  public static Opt<Long> stol (String n) {
167    try {
168      return Opt.some(Long.valueOf(n));
169    } catch (Exception e) {
170      return Opt.none();
171    }
172  }
173
174  /**
175   * Returns the float value of 'n' or 'Opt.none()' if 'n' is not a number.
176   * @param n String.
177   * @return Float value of 'n'.
178   */
179  public static Opt<Float> stof (String n) {
180    try {
181      return Opt.some(Float.valueOf(n));
182    } catch (Exception e) {
183      return Opt.none();
184    }
185  }
186
187  /**
188   * Returns the double value of 'n' or 'Opt.none()' if 'n' is not a number.
189   * @param n String.
190   * @return Double value of 'n'.
191   */
192  public static Opt<Double> stod (String n) {
193    try {
194      return Opt.some(Double.valueOf(n));
195    } catch (Exception e) {
196      return Opt.none();
197    }
198  }
199}
